title: Why did we include the French revolution and the American Civil in studying the Life of Rizal in the 19th century? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Because they were highly influenced Republican thought. First with the Enlightenment then Locke in America then France (which was awful) then elsewhere. But its important to know the origin of the thought. That said, Rizal was a poet and a good one. The personal letters of General Luna or Aguinaldo are better to get a sense of where they got their inspiration from. Personally I love the fact that the Philippines is the first country in Asia to be a constitutional Republic. Signed - Americano
